alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN LINCOLN COUNTY THROUGH 615 PM CDT... At 530 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles south of Brady, or 17 miles north of Curtis, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Vroman and Jeffrey Canyon State Wildlife Management Area. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 205 and 207. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in North Platte. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southwestern Nebraska.
